thinking.disposable_income: Willow Meadows/Willowbend is an upper-middle-income neighborhood with median household income around $100,000, indicating relatively high disposable income and ability to absorb transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have significant discretionary spending power and can generally afford higher transportation costs without major impact to their quality of life.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has good car accessibility to major employment centers, with most households owning cars, while transit service is limited mainly to bus routes connecting to the Medical Center and Downtown.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high car ownership and income levels, policies with moderate driving fees are acceptable if they improve transit service 2) Higher sales tax is less impactful due to high disposable income 3) Moderate transit fares balance revenue generation with encouraging transit use 4) Prioritized policies that reduce car travel times while making transit more competitive 5) Selected options that provide good transit service improvements without excessive costs to drivers
